description: a(n) = number of (s(0), s(1), ..., s(n)) such that s(i) is a nonnegative integer and |s(i) - s(i-1)| = 1 for i = 1,2,...,n and s(0) = 3. Also a(n) = Sum{T(n,k), k = 0,1,...,[ (n+3)/2 ]}, where T is defined in A026022.
comments: a(n)/2^n is the probability that a random walker starting at x=4 and jumping +-1 with equal probability at each time step is not adsorbed at the boundary x=0 at time n. - _Robert M. Ziff_, Nov 10 2014
author: _Clark Kimberling_
